intro: Melasma commune, commonly known as the common melasma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, waxy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Its botanical features include a robust root system and a woody stem that supports its dense foliage. Melasma commune is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
